info.title: Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-mesh-cfg
info.description:
Wireless Mesh Configuration
     Copyright (c) 2017-2023 by Cisco Systems, Inc.
     All rights reserved.

**Configuration Module**
**Module:** `Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-mesh-cfg`
**Paths:** 16

post.description: Add a new entry to This contains all attributes for the mesh psk config (collection)

get.description: This contains all attributes for the mesh psk config

put.description: Create or replace This contains all attributes for the mesh psk config

patch.description: Partially modify This contains all attributes for the mesh psk config

delete.description: Delete This contains all attributes for the mesh psk config

assoc-count-alarm-thresh.description: Threshold value for cumulative Association Count at parent mesh AP for generating Mesh Alarm

high-snr-alarm-thresh.description: Threshold value for higher SNR on backhaul link of a child mesh AP for generating Mesh Alarm

low-snr-alarm-thresh.description: Threshold value for lower SNR on backhaul link of a child mesh AP for generating Mesh Alarm

max-map-children-alarm-thresh.description: Threshold value for number of children MAPs on a parent MAAP for generating Mesh Alarm

max-rap-children-alarm-thresh.description: Threshold value for number of children MAPs on a parent RAP for generating Mesh Alarm

max-hop-alarm-thresh.description: Threshold value for number of hops from the MAP node to the RAP node for generating Mesh Alarm

parent-change-count-alarm-thresh.description: Threshold value for the number of times a child Mesh node changes its parent for generating Mesh Alarm

bhaul-rrm-enabled.description: This value indicates if RRM should be enabled or not in the backhaul radio of a root Mesh AP, which does not have any child Mesh APs

bhaul-bdomain-chan-used.description: This value indicates whether UNII B domain channels are enabled or not in the backhaul radio of Mesh Access Points

cac-enabled.description: This value indicates whether Call Admission Control is enabled or not for the Mesh Access Points

psk-prov-mode.description: This value indicates whether PSK provisioning is enabled or not for the Mesh AP

default-psk.description: Whether default psk is enabled or not for the Mesh AP

psk-inuse-index.description: This value indicates the PSK in-use key index

rap-channel-sync-enabled.description: This value indicates whether syncing of Mesh root AP channels across mobility group is enabled or not for Mesh

eth-bridging-bpdu-allowed.description: This value indicates whether we should allow BPDU packets on the Mesh network when Ethernet bridging is enabled

public-safety-enabled.description: This value indicates whether public safety band is enabled or not

auto-dca-rf-asic-aps.description: This value indicates if RRM DCA should be always enabled on the backhaul radio of a RF ASIC integrated mesh root AP

type.description: This value indicates the backhaul date rate type(auto, 802.11abg, 802.11n, 802.11ac)

rate.description: This value indicates enum value for Mesh backhaul 802.11 tx rate in kbps

dot11n-mcs-index.description: This value indicates Mesh backhaul tx rate 802.11n mcs index

dot11ac-mcs-index.description: This value indicates Mesh backhaul tx rate 802.11ac mcs index

spatial-stream.description: This value indicates Mesh backhaul tx rate 802.11ac spatial stream

dot11ax-mcs-index.description: This value indicates Mesh backhaul tx rate 802.11ax mcs index

dot11ax-spatial-stream-bg.description: This value indicates Mesh backhaul tx rate 802.11bg spatial stream

dot11ax-spatial-stream-a.description: This value indicates Mesh backhaul tx rate 802.11a spatial stream

unii3-bias.description: Add a 20% bias towards UNII-3 channels over other channels

use-unii2.description: Consider the channels in UNII-2 band in least congested channel scan

retries.description: Number of retries until gateway is considered unreachable

latency-excd-threshold.description: Interval in which at least one ping must succeed in less than threshold time

uplink-recovery-interval.description: Time during which RAP uplink has to be stable to accept child connections

keep-wireless-connection.description: Allow AP to keep its wireless connection with the parent without switching to wired channel

profile-name.description: This value indicates the name of Mesh profile

description.description: This value indicates the description of the psk key

amsdu-enabled.description: This value indicates whether A-MSDU is enabled or not on the backhaul radio of Mesh AP

bg-scan-enabled.description: This value indicates whether background scanning is enabled or not on the backhaul radio of Mesh AP

ccn-mode.description: This value indicates whether a parent Mesh AP should send Channel change notification for children mesh APs

bhaul-client-access.description: This value indicates whether Client Access is enabled or not on the Backhaul Radio of the Mesh AP

eth-vlan-transparent.description: This value indicates whether Ethernet bridging on Mesh APs should use vlan configuration or not

full-sector-dfs.description: This value indicates whether full sector DFS feature is enabled or not on the Mesh network

ids-state-enabled.description: This value indicates whether Mesh AP should send the IDS, rogue reports to WLC

multicast-mode.description: This value indicates the multicast mode over mesh network for Ethernet bridged multicast traffic

range.description: This value indicates the maximum range between outdoor root and mesh Access Points

security-mode.description: This value indicates the security method used for Mesh Access Points

conv-method.description: This value indicates Convergence method used in the Mesh Access Points

lsc-only-auth.description: This value indicates whether LSC Authentication is enabled or not for the Mesh AP

bridgegroupname.description: This value indicates if strict matching of bridge group name is enabled for Mesh Access Points for parent selection

bgn-strict-match-enabled.description: This value indicates whether Ethernet bridging is enabled or not for Mesh Access Points

eth-bridging-enabled.description: This value indicates whether Ethernet bridging is enabled or not for Mesh Access Points

battery-state-enabled.description: This value indicates whether external battery state is enabled or not for the Mesh Access Point

authorization-method.description: AAA method for the mesh access point authorization

authentication-method.description: AAA method for the mesh access point authentication

daisychain-stp-redundancy.description: This value indicates whether Daisy Chain STP Redundancy on Mesh APs is enabled or not

map-fast-ancestor-find.description: This value indicates whether MAP fast ancestor find is enabled or not on the backhaul radio of Mesh AP

rap-eth-daisychain.description: This value indicates whether RAP ethernet daisy-chain is enabled or not for Mesh RAP

type.description: This value indicates the backhaul date rate type(auto, 802.11abg, 802.11n, 802.11ac)

rate.description: This value indicates enum value for Mesh backhaul 802.11 tx rate in kbps

dot11n-mcs-index.description: This value indicates Mesh backhaul tx rate 802.11n mcs index

dot11ac-mcs-index.description: This value indicates Mesh backhaul tx rate 802.11ac mcs index

dot11ax-spatial-stream-bg.description: This value indicates Mesh backhaul tx rate 802.11bg spatial stream

dot11ax-spatial-stream-a.description: This value indicates Mesh backhaul tx rate 802.11a spatial stream

bhaul-tx-rate-dot11bg.description: Mesh backhaul tx rate for 2.4ghz radio backhaul

bg-scan-enabled.description: This value indicates whether background scanning is enabled or not on the backhaul radio of Mesh AP

ccn-mode.description: This value indicates whether a parent Mesh AP should send Channel change notification for children mesh APs

bhaul-client-access.description: This value indicates whether Client Access is enabled or not on the Backhaul Radio of the Mesh AP

eth-vlan-transparent.description: This value indicates whether Ethernet bridging on Mesh APs should use vlan configuration or not

full-sector-dfs.description: This value indicates whether full sector DFS feature is enabled or not on the Mesh network

ids-state-enabled.description: This value indicates whether Mesh AP should send the IDS, rogue reports to WLC

multicast-mode.description: This value indicates the multicast mode over mesh network for Ethernet bridged multicast traffic

range.description: This value indicates the maximum range between outdoor root and mesh Access Points

security-mode.description: This value indicates the security method used for Mesh Access Points

conv-method.description: This value indicates Convergence method used in the Mesh Access Points

lsc-only-auth.description: This value indicates whether LSC Authentication is enabled or not for the Mesh AP

bridgegroupname.description: This value indicates if strict matching of bridge group name is enabled for Mesh Access Points for parent selection

bgn-strict-match-enabled.description: This value indicates whether Ethernet bridging is enabled or not for Mesh Access Points

eth-bridging-enabled.description: This value indicates whether Ethernet bridging is enabled or not for Mesh Access Points

battery-state-enabled.description: This value indicates whether external battery state is enabled or not for the Mesh Access Point

authorization-method.description: AAA method for the mesh access point authorization

authentication-method.description: AAA method for the mesh access point authentication

daisychain-stp-redundancy.description: This value indicates whether Daisy Chain STP Redundancy on Mesh APs is enabled or not

map-fast-ancestor-find.description: This value indicates whether MAP fast ancestor find is enabled or not on the backhaul radio of Mesh AP

rap-eth-daisychain.description: This value indicates whether RAP ethernet daisy-chain is enabled or not for Mesh RAP

type.description: This value indicates the backhaul date rate type(auto, 802.11abg, 802.11n, 802.11ac)

rate.description: This value indicates enum value for Mesh backhaul 802.11 tx rate in kbps

dot11n-mcs-index.description: This value indicates Mesh backhaul tx rate 802.11n mcs index

dot11ac-mcs-index.description: This value indicates Mesh backhaul tx rate 802.11ac mcs index

spatial-stream.description: This value indicates Mesh backhaul tx rate 802.11ac spatial stream

dot11ax-mcs-index.description: This value indicates Mesh backhaul tx rate 802.11ax mcs index

dot11ax-spatial-stream-bg.description: This value indicates Mesh backhaul tx rate 802.11bg spatial stream

dot11ax-spatial-stream-a.description: This value indicates Mesh backhaul tx rate 802.11a spatial stream

bhaul-tx-rate-dot11bg.description: Mesh backhaul tx rate for 2.4ghz radio backhaul

type.description: This value indicates the backhaul date rate type(auto, 802.11abg, 802.11n, 802.11ac)

rate.description: This value indicates enum value for Mesh backhaul 802.11 tx rate in kbps

dot11n-mcs-index.description: This value indicates Mesh backhaul tx rate 802.11n mcs index

dot11ac-mcs-index.description: This value indicates Mesh backhaul tx rate 802.11ac mcs index

spatial-stream.description: This value indicates Mesh backhaul tx rate 802.11ac spatial stream

dot11ax-mcs-index.description: This value indicates Mesh backhaul tx rate 802.11ax mcs index

dot11ax-spatial-stream-bg.description: This value indicates Mesh backhaul tx rate 802.11bg spatial stream

dot11ax-spatial-stream-a.description: This value indicates Mesh backhaul tx rate 802.11a spatial stream

bhaul-tx-rate-dot11a.description: Mesh backhaul tx rate for 5ghz radio backhaul

unii3-bias.description: Add a 20% bias towards UNII-3 channels over other channels

use-unii2.description: Consider the channels in UNII-2 band in least congested channel scan

lc-scan.description: Enable mesh backhaul least congested channel scan

retries.description: Number of retries until gateway is considered unreachable

latency-excd-threshold.description: Interval in which at least one ping must succeed in less than threshold time

uplink-recovery-interval.description: Time during which RAP uplink has to be stable to accept child connections

keep-wireless-connection.description: Allow AP to keep its wireless connection with the parent without switching to wired channel

fast-teardown.description: Enable fast teardown of RAP ethernet uplink
